column1: Drowsiness detection systems are designed to detect when a driver is becoming drowsy and alert them to the danger. These systems use sensors to monitor the driver’s eye movements and other factors to determine when they are at risk of falling asleep at the wheel. Some drowsiness detection systems will even provide a warning to the driver and suggest a rest stop if they are deemed to be at risk. While these systems are not perfect
column2: they can be a valuable tool in preventing accidents caused by drowsy driving.

column1: There are many ways to detect drowsiness. One way is to measure the amount of time a person's eyes are closed. Another way is to measure the amount of time it takes a person to respond to a stimulus.

column1: Ensemble learning is a machine learning technique that combines multiple models to produce better results. It is often used in deep learning
column2: where multiple models are trained on different parts of the data and then combined to produce a better result. Ensemble learning can also be used to combine different types of models
column3: such as neural networks and decision trees.

column1: There are many face detection models available
column2: each with its own advantages and disadvantages. The Haar face detection model is fast but not very accurate. OpenCV's DNN face detection model is more accurate but slower. Dlib's CNN face detection model is the most accurate but also the slowest.

column1: Deep learning is a neural network architecture that has been designed to learn in a way that is similar to how the brain learns. Transfer learning is a technique that can be used to improve the performance of a deep learning model by using knowledge that has been learned by another model.
MobileNet is a neural network that is used for image classification and recognition. It was developed by Google and is available for use on a variety of devices
column2: including the Raspberry Pi. YOLO is another neural network that is used for object detection. It was developed by Joseph Redmon and is also available for use on the Raspberry Pi.
